item.title: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Full PC Specs Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/indiana-jones-and-the-great-circle-full-pc-specs-revealed/

The full PC specs for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle have been revealed by Bethesda. The reveal comes ahead of the game’s Early Access launch on December 5.

Without anymore delay, let’s get right to what type of PC you’ll need to hit various performance goals for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle PC Specs

Standard Requirements:

Minimum PC Specs:

  • OS: 64-bit Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-10700K @ 3.8 GHz or better, or AMD Ryzen 5 3600 @ 3.6 GHz or better
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2060 SUPER 8 GB, AMD Radeon RX 6600 8 GB, or Intel Arc A580
  • Storage: 120 GB
  • Additional Notes: SSD required; GPU Hardware Ray Tracing required; Graphic Preset: Low / Resolution: 1080p (Native) / Target FPS: 60

Recommended PC Specs:

  • OS: 64-bit Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-12700K @ 3.6 GHz or better, or AMD Ryzen 7 7700 @ 3.8 GHz or better
  • Memory: 32 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080Ti 12 GB, or AMD Radeon RX 7700XT 12 GB
  • Storage: 120 GB
  • Additional Notes: SSD required; GPU Hardware Ray Tracing required; Graphic Preset: High / Resolution: 1440p (Native) / Target FPS: 60

Ultra PC Specs:

  • OS: 64-bit Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-13900K @ 3.0 GHz or better, or AMD Ryzen 7 7900X @ 4.7 GHz or better
  • Memory: 32 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4080 16 GB, or AMD Radeon RX 7900XT 20 GB
  • Storage: 120 GB
  • Additional Notes: SSD required; GPU Hardware Ray Tracing required; Graphic Preset: Ultra / Resolution: 4K (Native) / Target FPS: 60

Full Ray Tracing Requirements:

Minimum PC Specs:

  • OS: 64-bit Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-10700K @ 3.8 GHz or better, or AMD Ryzen 5 3600 @ 3.6 GHz or better
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 12 GB
  • Storage: 120 GB
  • Additional Notes: SSD required; GPU Hardware Ray Tracing required; DLSS 3 with Frame Generation & Super Resolution Preset: Balanced; Graphic Preset: Low / Resolution: 1080p (Upscaled) / Target FPS: 60

Recommended PC Specs:

  • OS: 64-bit Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-12700K @ 3.6 GHz or better, or AMD Ryzen 7 7700 @ 3.8 GHz or better
  • Memory: 32 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4080 16 GB
  • Storage: 120 GB
  • Additional Notes: SSD required; GPU Hardware Ray Tracing required; DLSS 3 with Frame Generation & Super Resolution Preset: Quality; Graphic Preset: High / Resolution: 1440p (Upscaled) / Target FPS: 60

Ultra PC Specs:

  • OS: 64-bit Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-13900K @ 3.0 GHz or better, or AMD Ryzen 7 7900X @ 4.7 GHz or better
  • Memory: 32 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090 24 GB
  • Storage: 120 GB
  • Additional Notes: SSD required; GPU Hardware Ray Tracing required; DLSS 3 with Frame Generation & Super Resolution Preset: Performance; Graphic Preset: Ultra / Resolution: 4K (Upscaled) / Target FPS: 60

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle releases for everyone on December 9. The game will be available for Xbox Series X|S, PC, and via Game Pass. A PlayStation 5 release is set to come in spring 2025.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what former PlayStation executive Shawn Layden had to say about the PS3 era.. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: PlayStation Was “Lucky” To Survive PS3 Era, Former Executive Says
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/playstation-was-lucky-to-survive-ps3-era-former-executive-says/

The PlayStation 3 (PS3) era could’ve been the end of PlayStation as we know it. That’s according to former PlayStation executive Shawn Layden.

In a new interview with Eurogamer, Layden spoke on a number of topics about the console that turned 30 on December 3. One of the topics, in particular, centered around the PS3 and its disastrous launch in 2006.

For those who either don’t remember or were too young, the PS3 was panned at its launch due to the console’s pricing, lack of launch titles, and development issues, among other concerns. It’s a moment in time that Layden said had people at the company “happy to have survived”.

“PS3 was Sony’s Icarus moment,” he said. “We had PS1, PS2… and now we’re building a supercomputer! And we’re going to put Linux on it! And we’re going to do all these sorts of things! We flew too close to the sun, and we were lucky and happy to have survived the experience, but it taught us a lot.”

Layden continued buy saying that Sony learned for the development of the PS4 that they don’t necessarily have to build everything for the console in-house. It’s ok to buy components if possible.

“You can manage the cost better,” he said. You can argue with vendors, get better deals instead of building your own thing.

“We also learned that the center of the machine has to be gaming. It’s not about whether I can stream movies or play music. Can I order a pizza while I’m watching TV and play? No, just make it a game machine. Just make it the best game machine of all time. I think that’s what really made the difference. When PS4 came out, it set us against what Xbox was trying to do. [They wanted to] build more of a multimedia experience, and we just wanted to build a kick ass game machine.”

The PS3 ultimately rebounded from its launch to sell 87.4 million consoles. That put it just ahead of the Xbox 360’s 85.7M in lifetime sales but below the Wii’s 101.6M.

What do you think of Layden’s view that Sony was happy to have survived the PS3 launch and era? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the Insider Gaming staff’s favorite original PlayStation games. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: When Can You Play Indiana Jones and the Great Circle? – Full Release Times
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/when-can-you-play-indiana-jones-and-the-great-circle-full-release-times/

The release of Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is just days away, and players finally have an idea of when they’ll be able to go on Indy’s next big adventure. In a post on social media, Bethesda announced the times when you’ll be able to play Indiana Jones and the Great Circle.

If you pre-ordered the Premium or Collector’s Editions of Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, you’ll get access as early as December 5 at 4pm, depending on your location. Those with the Standard Edition will have to wait until December 8 at 4pm at the earliest. You can check out the full release times for both Early Access and Standard for various time zones below.

RELATED: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Install Size is 131GB

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Release Times

Early Access (December 5th-6th)

  • Los Angeles (PST): December 5, 4:00 PM
  • Chicago (CST): December 5, 6:00 PM
  • Ciudad de México (CST): December 5, 6:00 PM
  • New York (EST): December 5, 7:00 PM
  • London (GMT): December 6, 12:00 AM
  • Paris (CET): December 6, 1:00 AM
  • Berlin (CET): December 6, 1:00 AM
  • Uppsala (CET): December 6, 1:00 AM
  • Riyadh (AST): December 6, 3:00 AM
  • Delhi (IST): December 6, 5:30 AM
  • Beijing (CST): December 6, 8:00 AM
  • Hong Kong (HKT): December 6, 8:00 AM
  • Seoul (KST): December 6, 9:00 AM
  • Tokyo (JST): December 6, 9:00 AM
  • Sydney (AEDT): December 6, 11:00 AM
  • Auckland (NZDT): December 6, 1:00 PM

Release Times PC and Console (December 8th-9th)

  • Los Angeles (PST): December 8, 4:00 PM
  • Chicago (CST): December 8, 6:00 PM
  • Ciudad de México (CST): December 8, 6:00 PM
  • New York (EST): December 8, 7:00 PM
  • London (GMT): December 9, 12:00 AM
  • Paris (CET): December 9, 1:00 AM
  • Berlin (CET): December 9, 1:00 AM
  • Uppsala (CET): December 9, 1:00 AM
  • Riyadh (AST): December 9, 3:00 AM
  • Delhi (IST): December 9, 5:30 AM
  • Beijing (CST): December 9, 8:00 AM
  • Hong Kong (HKT): December 9, 8:00 AM
  • Seoul (KST): December 9, 9:00 AM
  • Tokyo (JST): December 9, 9:00 AM
  • Sydney (AEDT): December 9, 11:00 AM
  • Auckland (NZDT): December 9, 1:00 PM

When are you going to start playing Indiana Jones and the Great Circle? For more Insider Gaming, check out the Insider Gaming staff’s favorite original PlayStation games.

item.title: Dan Houser’s Absurd Ventures Gets Investment From Lost Ark Developer Smilegate
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/dan-housers-absurd-ventures-gets-investment-from-lost-ark-developer-smilegate/

Absurd Ventures, the new studio formed by Rockstar Games co-founder Dan Houser, has a new partner in Lost Ark developer Smilegate.

Announced on Tuesday, the partnership is being called a “strategic investment” by both sides that “aims to create vast and sustainable business opportunities”. Smilegate is the studio behind games such as Lost Ark and Crossfire.

“This collaboration with Smilegate was borne from a mutual respect and a philosophical alignment with founder Kwon, and the great passion he and his team bring to making AAA games,” Houser said via press release. “We both want to build interesting worlds and new player experiences.”

Joonhoo Sung, Smilegate’s CEO, added: “We are thrilled to collaborate with the developers behind globally renowned series that have millions of fans worldwide. Together with Absurd Ventures, Smilegate aims to deliver games that players across the globe will love. This partnership marks a critical milestone in Smilegate’s journey toward becoming a global IP powerhouse.”

Absurd Ventures is currently working on a AAA third-person open world game and recently saw developers from Immortals of Aveum join the team. There was no update on what this investment from Smilegate will do for the development of their current game, or if things will change with how Absurd Ventures operates.

For more Insider Gaming, check out full details on the latest major update for STALKER 2. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: IEM Dallas 2025 Will Run Alongside DreamHack Once Again
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/iem-dallas-dreamhack-2025/

It has been confirmed by ESL FACEIT that IEM Dallas will run alongside DreamHack Dallas in Texas in May 2025.

From May 23 – 25, the world’s most prolific Counter-Strike teams will descend on Texas to take part in IEM Dallas, one of the most prestigious events in the CS2 esports calendar.

Read on to get the full story.

IEM Going to Texas

This year’s IEM Dallas event was a monumental spectacle, with the event going down to the wire between G2 Esports and Team Vitality. It ended up being a win for G2, putting an end to a cold period that had lasted since the team won at IEM Cologne in August 2023.

It effectively kickstarted a spree for G2, with the team going on to win big at the BLAST Fall Final and then the BLAST World Final later in the year. The squad also wound up in second place in Counter-Strike’s tournament at the Esports World Cup.

In a press release, it was written:

ESL FACEIT Group, the leading esports and video game entertainment company, today announced DreamHack Dallas and Intel® Extreme Masters (IEM) Dallas 2025 will jointly return to Texas’ Key Bailey Hutchison Convention Center on May 23-25.

The pair of events will rally tens of thousands of gaming and esports fans to witness top-tier competition, hundreds of their favorite creators, dozens of indie titles, and more.

Tickets will go on sale from December 5 – are you interested in heading to IEM Dallas? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

Stay tuned to Insider Gaming for the latest esports news

item.title: STALKER 2 1.03 Update Fixes Mission and Save-Related Issues
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/stalker-2-1-03-update-gsc-fix/

GSC has released a small update for STALKER 2 that addresses some issues with memory leaks, controls, AI, and missions. This is the third update that has dropped since the game was released on November 20, and it’s indicative of GSC’s intention to patch the game as much as possible following mixed feedback and reviews.

In my eyes, STALKER 2 is fantastic – and my review of the game was glowing. If I’m being honest, I’ve not experienced many – if any – of the issues fixed in this latest update, but you might have.

Check out the list below.

STALKER 2 1.03 Fixes and Changes

Here’s the list of everything updated or changed by GSC Game World in the 1.03 update for STALKER 2. I’ve removed anything that could be considered spoiler-related:

Crashes and Memory Leaks

  • Multiple ACCESS_VIOLATION_ERROR fixes
  • Multiple LowLevelFatalError crash fixes

Control Adjustments

According to your feedback, we adjusted the following parameters/values to decrease input lag on keyboard+mouse input:

  • Mouse Smoothing is disabled by default
  • Mouse Acceleration is disabled by default

Additionally, default values of mouse sensitivity were updated to allow a predictable default experience for our players with new values of two parameters mentioned below:

  • Camera sensitivity: 25%
  • Aim sensitivity: 15%

Main and Side Missions

  • Fixed issue with ___ that were able to chase player outside  during the In Search of Past Glory mission
  • Fixed an issue where the NPCs ___ would die after trying to enter a building during the mission On the Edge
  • Fixed issue with ___ which could despawn before player loots a collar from it during In the Name of Science mission
  • Fixed issue with player potentially locking oneself during Dangerous Liaisons mission
  • Fixed issue with ___ becoming hostile upon noticing a player ___ during King of the Hill mission
  • Fixed an issue when ___ despawns in front of the player after the dialog in the bunker during A Heavy Burden mission
  • Fixed issue with NPC’s despawning when player successfully finishes Legends of the Zone mission

AI

  • Fixed an issue with mutant bodies stretching after a shot from an automatic weapon
  • Fixed an issue that caused NPCs to block the doors during the Back to the Slag Heap mission

Balance

  • Fixed issue with ___ not selling certain ammo types

Saves

  • Fixed issues with missing player saves after a hard reboot of the PC/Xbox

Does this patch resolve any of your issues? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Fallout 76 has had a huge endgame update
